description: The Hollyhock (Alcea Rosea) is an incredible flower that makes a stunning addition to any garden. With its beautiful, five petal blooms, the plant can reach up to 6 feet in height and can be found in a variety of colors including pink, yellow, white, and purple. The flowers are most often single and tend to be bi-colored with a dark center. Planting this flower in your garden will provide you with a great deal of beauty and contrast as the leaves and flower buds take on a deep purple hue before the blooms appear. Not only are these flowers eye-catching, but they are also highly fragrant, perfect for attracting pollinators to your garden.
